reviews.text: We went to Dominica for our Honeymoon, stayed for 7 nights at Fort Young. We ended up staying in 4 different rooms - the reason is because we had only booked for 2 night and our plans to take the ferry to Martinique were thwarted by an oversold ferry for Easter Weekend.
reviews.title: By far the best and modern hotel

reviews.text: Anyway, I highly recommend spending the extra money to stay in the "new" wing of the hotel. It is modern, airconditioned with relaxing ocean views. Beatiful rooms, truly. Now the "old" section is more than adequate, but instead of ocean views, it has sometimes noisy views of the town. We also had some mosquito problems in the old section (our travel book mistakenly said the hotel was above the mosquito line). Overall, a beautiful hotel, and by far the best choice if you want a more modern delux experience.
reviews.title: Great base but not a reflection of Dominica

reviews.text: We stayed at the Fort Young for a week - it is an excellent base for diving - they pick you up from the dock each morning, Dive Dominica are fantastic, and its only about 20mins to the dive sites.
reviews.title: Excellent! Great room and service, outstanding view.

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel last month. The Fort Young is probably as good as it gets in Roseau. The staff is generally friendly, and sometimes a few go the extra mile. But in general, management is absent, or nonexistant leaving staff to try to figure out what's going on. If you have a pressing need to get anything done- phone call made, reservation confirmed, copy made, etc. staff will usually make an effort, but everytime it's as though they've invented the wheel for the first time, if they figure out how to do it at all. It takes numerous, numerous calls to check and make sure things have happened. The food is second rate and overpriced. The pool is quite nice, and location excellent.
reviews.title: Probably as good as it gets......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, it's a comfortable place to stay, made adequate by friendly staff who manage to make things run despite an apparent total absence of effective management. Woe to this place if a professional chain ever hits Roseau. The Fort Young is only in business because it holds a virtual monopoly on business class hotels.
reviews.title: We love Fort Young, and can't wait to come back to Dominica!
Beautiful property terribly managed
reviews.text: We (meaning myself, my boyfriend, and another couple) recently stayed with the Fort Young during our week vacation in Dominica. We loved the property and will stay with them again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is literally on the edge of the cliff, overlooking the water. This meant that breakfast, lunch and dinner we sat with a breath taking view of the ocean. Prices of the meals were as expected, but the quality of the food the best on island. They always had a choice of typical and local dishes. Definitely try their rum punch!
reviews.title: The Closest Thing to a Luxury Hotel in Dominica

likes.liked: — excellent rooms, superb bathrooms, nice kind maids, excellent cleaning service
likes.disliked: — bad service overall, except for the maids (but decent overall compared to anywhere else in Dominica, the staff at Fort Young are getting better slowly, day by day).

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed in the deluxe oceanfront room, which is beautiful with a large granite top bathroom that I'd love to have in my own home. We also had a private balcony, which most nights we left the door open to fall asleep to the sounds of the waves. Our friends however, wanted to save money, so they had an oceanview room (the original fort section of the hotel we later found out). Their room and bathroom was quite a bit smaller, nothing special. So my advice, if all you need is a place to shower and sleep (like many of us divers), the oceanview is the way to go. Otherwise, pay the extra money for the upgrade.
reviews.title: Unlucky stay at Fort Young

reviews.text: I was in Dominica for a morning meeting and satyed at the Fort Young for one night. I attempted to check in early about 11:00 am before my meeting but my room was not ready. While I waited I made the mistake of having the most expensive sandwhich I had ever eaten from the Balour Bar. US$8.00 plus service charge plus 15% tax!!!
reviews.title: More attention to the little things

reviews.text: When I finally got my room after the meeting, it turned out that the view from my Oceanview room (519) was actually a view of the roof of another block and the branches of some palms. So much for paying extra to get a view of the sea!
reviews.title: Great experience at Fort Young

likes.liked: — Clean, quiet room with beautiful view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was basic but comfortable enough. The water pressure in the shower was low and the shower stall extremely small. I hate having to brush against the shower curtain when bathing- I just don't get that clean feeling. On afternoon, the rooms can be pretty hot as the sun blazes down on the west.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

likes.liked: — Beuatiful sunsets and sound of the sea as your fall asleep
likes.disliked: — Quite a few stairs so not great for people with disabilities, though there is a lift

reviews.text: I tried to get lunch about 3:00 but the restaurants were closed and I ws advised that even off property, it was unlikely that I would get anything to eat until 7pm. A staff member recommended ordering a snack from the bar menu but after my sandwhich experience, decided to pass.
reviews.title: Nice hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had diner off property since I could not wait till the hotel's restaurants opened for diner at 7 but decided to have desert and wine in the hotel's waterfront restaurant since I wanted to expereince it. I was informed (quite rudely I might add) that they were quite busy that night and I should have my desrt and wine by the bar!!! I sweetly asked the maitre'd if they were full and I guess by my tone and sarcasm, she got my point and gave me a table. That quite turned me off.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel... avoid the activities desk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is stunning. The rooms are very spacious, clean, well equipped and beautifully furnished, as is the rest of the hotel. Our room had a balcony over the sea, we woke up to the sound of the waves lapping below. The views over the Caribbean sea with Scott's Head to the left are incredible. The food is fresh and delicious and the staff can't do enough to help. Lovely memories, I'd go back again and again.
reviews.title: Fort Young - I'd go back again and again

likes.liked: — It was so open and spacious and clean and GREAT location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ft. Young Hotel worked out very well for us, as we went to Dominica mainly for scuba diving. The hotel is nestled into a very old fort, and you are always having to go over the walls, or around the walls, etc. It adds to the spirit of adventure that's everywhere in Dominica.
reviews.title: A friendly hotel, a different experience

likes.liked: — View of the Caribbean at sunset
likes.disliked: — Our room was close to the bar, which was noisy some nights.

reviews.text: There's a dive shop connected to the hotel, and Dive Dominica picks you up in their boat every day.
reviews.title: Great time at the Fort Young

likes.liked: — the staff; food; excursions available; very nice rooms
likes.disliked: — took a while to get anywhere - but that's what it's like everywhere in Dominica!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The marine environment is rated among the best in the world, and based on my experience, I believe it. The sea conditions were a bit rough the week we were there, and we got banged up a little getting on and off the boats, but it was worth it to see the world underneath the waves.
reviews.title: Very happy with the Fort Young Hotel

likes.liked: — Great base for visiting the island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all the hotel was clean, the view from our waterfront room was nice, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the Waterfront Restaurant is very nice indeed! I would certainly stay in the Ft. Young Hotel if I went back to Dominica.
reviews.title: Well worth the trip

likes.liked: — location, size and quality of the room, friendliness of the staff
